intro: Schoenoxiphium thunbergii, commonly known as the Japanese thunbergia, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas.
